title: Telegraph Investor General Investment Account: choice and control at your fingertips
text: Whilst an ISA and SIPP enable you to take advantage of inbuilt income and capital gains tax efficiencies they have two drawbacks. Both restrict the amount you can pay in each year in order to benefit from those tax-efficiencies, and both limit your ability to withdraw money when you want without implications. What’s more, the ISA regulations limit the type of investment you can choose. So, for unfettered access to your money and to investment choices, our General Investment Account could be the answer. Many of our customers use a GIA alongside their ISA or SIPP, so if you open one of those accounts we’ll automatically add a GIA. And because we don’t charge separate investment administration fees for each account type, this added flexibility is good value too. (Please note, a separate SIPP Administration fee applies – see our charges for details.) • Investment choice – all in one place Whether you prefer to invest via funds or Investment Trusts for a more hands-off ‘managed’ approach, track indices with ETFs, pick your own individual stocks or take an active approach trading derivative-based investments such as Covered Warrants and Structured Products, you’ll find the breadth of choice you need to match your investment approach. And the information you need to help you make your choices. (Please note that in order to trade ‘complex investment’ types you will need to successfully complete an appropriateness assessment.) • Cost–effective, efficient, investment administration – we’ll take care of the detail We don’t make a separate charge for each account you hold with us, there’s just one quarterly fee that totals 0.3% p.a. of your account value. It’s a cost effective way to manage your investments, with a minimum of £5 a quarter and never more than £300 a year. • and great value dealing - whether you trade online or by phone Buy and sell funds for free, and all other assets classes, from UK and International shares and Investment Trusts to Bonds and ETFs, for £10 per trade, whether online or by phone. (Stamp duty and other statutory charges apply.) See our Charges Investment ideas – online and in your mailbox Looking for inspiration and ideas? You’ll find both with share tipsexpert opinion from the Telegraph’s Questor columnist, daily investment commentary and ideas from our award-winning journalists and our free weekly newsletter via email. Whilst they’re not tailored to individual circumstances they can be a good place to start. Open your account today > Please bear in mind that the value of investments, and any income from them, can fall as well as rise so you could get back less than you invest. Past performance is no guarantee of future performance. ‘Complex investments’ are not suitable for all investors; please make sure you understand the additional risk involved. If unsure about whether any investment is suitable, please take independent advice. Tax rules can change over time and the benefit of sheltering your investments from tax in an ISA or SIPP will depend on your personal circumstances.
